meanings.definition: The state of being unproductive or infertile.
meanings.sent1: The barrenness of the land made it difficult to grow any crops.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was disappointed by the barrenness of his fields this season.
meanings.sent3: The barrenness of the garden was so extreme that even the weeds refused to grow.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a barrenness, devoid of any creative ideas.
meanings.sent5: The barrenness of the desert stretched out endlessly, with no signs of life in sight.

meanings.definition: The quality of being empty or desolate.
meanings.sent1: The barrenness of the room made it feel cold and unwelcoming.
meanings.sent2: The barrenness of the landscape was both eerie and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The barrenness of the playground on a rainy day made it a perfect spot for puddle jumping.
meanings.sent4: His heart echoed with a barrenness, longing for the warmth of companionship.
meanings.sent5: The barrenness of the abandoned house gave it an air of mystery and sadness.
